website_summaries.verdict: This well-liked guide is a convenient size for taking with you and has great photos.
pros: Beautiful photographs assist in mushroom identification
A compact size for carrying around
Information is concise but sufficiently complete
Comprehensive for its size with over 700 mushrooms
cons: Photos and descriptions are in separate sections, so could be better organized

customer_reviews.title: Great book, but I've had it for less than ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book, but I've had it for less than a week and noticed an error. The photos and labels for the purple-spores puffball (a choice edible) and the poison pigskin puffball were switched. An important error that should be corrected in future editions. Found this out by cross referencing it with MO Department of Conservation's field guide. So use this as a great resource, but ALWAYS get lots of info from different sources before thinking your identification is 100% correct.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah V.

customer_reviews.title: Buy a regional guide instead
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this without realizing how many pages I'd have to leaf through and how many descriptions to read closely before realizing that said mushroom only grows outside of my state. In other words, this is useful if you mushroom all over the country, otherwise you're much better off buying a regional guide
customer_reviews.author: Plant ecology

customer_reviews.title: A good place to start
customer_reviews.text: This is my first reference book on fungi identification and so far I'm finding it really helpful. Some more experienced individuals seem to have some complaints but for me, as a novice it seems like a good starting point if nothing else. The text is seperated into two main sections that being one section of images and the second part is the text and information. It's a nice, compact field guide and for now at least in my case it will do the job in helping me to identify various types of fungi.
customer_reviews.author: Althaea

customer_reviews.title: Detailed Information With Lots of Color Photographs
customer_reviews.text: I got this book for my dad, who has long been into canning and pickling. As he often comes across different vegetables and mushrooms in the wild, he was curious to learn more about them. He was happy to get this book, which is very detailed, including information about seasonal mushrooms, edibility, identifying marks, among other things. And perhaps the best feature, theres a TON of color photographs to help with identifying different varieties. My dad has found a lot of help from this book, so it was a well-made purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany M.Top Contributor: Manga

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The book is nicely crafted and small like a hand held bible. Nice colorful pages and I can throw in a grab and run bag if I needed to be in the wilderness. I dont like that its not obvious which ones are poisonous? I mean thats the whole point of the purchase. Put a red x next to the poisonous ones. Theres so many species. Just make it simple to identify the danger.
customer_reviews.author: Ceo

customer_reviews.title: Top notch. Superb guide for the Northeast.
customer_reviews.text: Audubon's field guides are known to be among the best available for field identification of species. This mushroom guide is no exception. Beautiful photos, relevant information, and logical layout. I have used this guide to pick, prepare and consume seven different species of mushrooms from the woods around my home so far. I feel confident in being able to do so because of the thoroughness of the information herein. So far this is THE BEST field guide I have seen for this purpose. I can honestly recommend this book to anyone in the northeast area of the U.S.
customer_reviews.author: John Andocs

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome. We have recently started hiking and running across all sorts of mushrooms in the wild. We were curious as to what we were seeing. We bring this book with us now and are able to identify our discoveries with ease. The color photos enable exact identification, and the corresponding information pages educate us on all the properties of each new find. This book has inspired us to buy more from National Audubon Society. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn P.

customer_reviews.title: loads of info, I MEAN LOADS OF INFO!!
customer_reviews.text: while this book is a bit hard to navigate, it has way more then i expected in useful information. a little large for a carry guide, but the extra weight is worth it. nice pictures for most of the mushrooms and fungi. even tells you the ones to stay the hell away from or you gone die. lol ,if you like hanging outside and checking out mother nature, this book is worth every penny. if you are like me, you like to be the smart guy and point out different things in nature to your friends, and shine it up with a name.
customer_reviews.author: congobongoofthethirdorder

customer_reviews.title: the first 30 pages are missing or upside down
customer_reviews.text: The book looks really nice on the outside and in. However, i got jipped off on the first 30 pages which look very informative from the few upside down pages I have. I would be more than happy to give a 5 star review if I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: shagggs

customer_reviews.title: It's ok not up to my expectations and others recommendation
customer_reviews.text: I'm just not impressed. Photos didn't seem very helpful. Some good info but I just feel like this could have been much better laid out and better quality photos. Are they using photos from the 80s? Idk. It'll help in the field but I guess I'd hoped for more out of it. That being said I think it's an ok book and I'd still have bought it at a store maybe but wait for a sale and have bought the better ones for my collection first.
customer_reviews.author: Nihx Knows

customer_reviews.title: Informative
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive book with excellent photographs. Within minutes of receiving it I was able to find and identify a mushroom that I had photographed years ago and have been wondering about. I am looking forward to mushroom hunting season!
customer_reviews.author: C. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: I like the book but
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent book but, the pictures of the mushrooms are in one section of the book and the description is a couple hundred pages away. Showing a few different angles of the mushrooms would really help identify them. A bunch of the mushrooms don't even say if they're edible even though they are. I like the book but, just too annoying looking for page #'s while walking the woods.
customer_reviews.author: B K

customer_reviews.title: Outdated
customer_reviews.text: This book is 20yrs out of date. The are species not in here due to this, making this book unuable for mushrooms "discovered" after 2000 or more correctly 1999
customer_reviews.author: d s

customer_reviews.title: small photos with bad color rendition.
customer_reviews.text: Many of the photos were not useful for identification. Either the color rendition was bad (perhaps due reciprocity failure using long exposure slide film), the contrast was too high to make out details, or the photos had no contrast and were "muddy". The quantity and quality of the photos is afterall the most important aspects for a book intended to assist in identification of mushrooms !
customer_reviews.author: marcus surrealleous

customer_reviews.title: A fungus is amongus
customer_reviews.text: This is a great guide! I feel almost safe just eating random mushrooms. The pictures are really good high gloss and it has a neat way of finding what you are looking for. 1UP from a Mario!
customer_reviews.author: douglas miles

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide
customer_reviews.text: This book is excellent. There are a ton of good to great pictures of north american mushroom species as well as detailed descriptions of all parts of the mushrooms. All species are identified by the scientific name, and also have a common name(s) with the descriptions and pictures. There are also sections on poisoning illness, spore printing, and cooking. The book is well organized so that it is easy to find mushrooms depending on traits. I certainly recommend the book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for new mushroom hunters
customer_reviews.text: I'm very new to this hobby and don't have a lot of experience identifying species. I've tried a few different books, but this is the be-all, end-all book. The photos are amazing, the explanations and details are phenomenal. More than 750+ species photographed and described. So thrilled to have found this resource.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: It is a great resource if you are interested in nature walks and ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a great resource if you are interested in nature walks and identifying wild mushrooms, however I must say you should purchase Mushrooms Demystified alongside this book. The reason why is the audubon book has great color pictures, but Mushrooms Demystified is the only book I've found that actually teaches you how to use a mushroom book properly. Color, for example, is not the best indicator of what something is.
customer_reviews.author: Garzo

customer_reviews.title: SMELLS LIKE MUSHROOMS!
customer_reviews.text: I recently became interested in looking for mushrooms on my hikes and bought this book. It is very easy to use, well organized, and has beautiful color plates. Perfect for carrying along on my hikes to try to identify all the fungi I encounter I noticed while flipping through the color plates that for some reason they smell kind of like mushrooms. It is quite robust and I don't think is attributable just to the power of suggestion. Has anyone else noticed this? Awesome! Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive but not field-friendly
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive field guide. It's lacking a lot of photos, and the pages are extremely lightweight and thin-- definitely not a field guide you would want to take in to the field, especially in the rain...which is where you would want to be taking a field guide when trying to identify mushrooms. I think the pages would literally melt if I took it in the field with me here in the PNW. Very small font. Packs a ton of info in.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Nice guide to mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: These types of guides from the society are always informative and easy to use. I really enjoy them every time I read or buy them. The organization is easy to navigate. All the mushrooms are grouped.
customer_reviews.author: Dash10

customer_reviews.title: Great Guide
customer_reviews.text: These field guides are excellent. It is easy to use and the pictures are clear and concise. The categories are separated into types of mushrooms; caps, coral, shelf, etc...There is also information about mushroom hunting and what is known to be edible. What is poisonous and what is unknown. There is information about taking spore prints and descriptions as well as line drawings for distinguishing gill arrangement and attachment. I had an absolute blast running around the fields and forests looking for fungus, thumbing through the book to identify it, photographing it and learning to take spore prints. Though this book does not have pictures for all the fungus among us, it is an excellent guide for any mushroom hunter.
customer_reviews.author: FatalDegree

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE & VERY GOOD VALUE
customer_reviews.text: This is a well laid out book with great information and pictures for identification, this is one of three resources I have in my pack at all times while hunting fungi. This book did not disappoint and is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Not for those seeking to positively ID a mushroom.
customer_reviews.text: Has no formal classification instructions for the mushrooms. It just gives some pictures and descriptions of the mushrooms. No proper, step-by-step breakout instructions on the specifics of a positive / negative ID. Even many of the most popular edible mushrooms (like boletes) are either not in the book or there is insufficient information to positively ID them.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot Gable

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing book.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing book...Not only is there full color photographs but it teaches you all about mushrooms. From the the way the cap looks to the spore print...You'll be eating some wonderful edible wild mushrooms in no time with the help of the National Audubon Society's Field Guide to Mushrooms...This is probably the best book I have on mushrooms
customer_reviews.author: skeeter

customer_reviews.title: All Great Books
customer_reviews.text: You have to be a doofus not to like rocks, weather, wildflowers, and trees. If you buy this entire series, you will be an instant convert and lover of the natural world.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Salniker

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Good find while online searching! Has beautiful pictures and information on the mushroom in different section. Provides good info on the mushroom. Not a book for in-depth detail on medicinal healing. Great for reference!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pictures
customer_reviews.text: Good pictures, but common names given for many of the mushrooms were actually made up by the author solely for this book and are not really used by other mycologists.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Miles

customer_reviews.title: Audubon's Guide to North American Mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: This book is a comprehensive guide to the mushrooms one might find in North America. It is organized so as to help you identify the mushrooms and tells which are edible and which ones to avoid. I like it because it is compact and easy to carry into the wild, and has many color pictures so that you won't mis-identify a mushroom and get sick. It uses a a key system to systematically identify mushrooms to make sure of their identity before you make a mistake. A very handy reference guide that I would recommend for anyone who is interested in harvesting wild mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Roseanne M. Sittler

customer_reviews.title: Linkoff is to mushrooms what Bono is to Africa lol
customer_reviews.text: This is as close to perfect as any mushroom guide I've seen. I definitely recommend it for beginners to help build you're confidence in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great primer for anyone with budding interest in fungus among us
customer_reviews.text: This is a very educational book for general knowledge and visual confirmation of different species of this exotic and mysterious growth. I learned enough very quickly how important it is to correctly identify the various types of 'shrooms in natural settings. Very concise information and great colour pictures. One caveat; if you are in search of information on 'magic' mushrooms, look for another source, as this book, as good as it is, does not dwell on this aspect, and barely mentions which species hold the keys to enlightenment. The dangers of ingesting incorrectly cannot be overemphasized.
customer_reviews.author: joelfarm

customer_reviews.title: Great to have when in the woods
customer_reviews.text: Great to have when in the woods. Pictures and descritions are very thorough. Saved me a couple times from harvesting wrong type...
customer_reviews.author: Julie Freiters

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, comprehensive guide
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive, easy to use mushroom guide. Excellent for a mycologist and fungi enthusiast. Really like and have enjoyed this book.
customer_reviews.author: BaciBisou

customer_reviews.title: Good tead3
customer_reviews.text: Great to have if your interested in mushroom foraging Even if you dont use it as a firld guide just to learn a bit
customer_reviews.author: richard martinez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect field companion
customer_reviews.text: I can’t find anything better for identification. Even taking online resources into consideration. I love in Texas and although there are a few differences in some of the appearance of certain varietals. Easy to use! Make sure to connect to a local Mycology group to help with identifications with some of the more difficult to figure out ones.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Croft

customer_reviews.title: A good, informative book with good pictures
customer_reviews.text: A good, informative book with good pictures. I prefer pictures and text being together rather than having to flip pages to read about the pictures. On the other hand, looking at six pictures on two pages is nice too for narrowing the choice of identification. Also a small map showing area of possible location of mushroom would be helpful. Preference of where they grow like under oak, pine, in meadows, bogs, etc helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: National Audubon Society Mushroom Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book for identifying mushrooms, especially in the eastern United States.Very good pictures to help with identification. I highly recommend this book for anyone wanting to get outdoors and look for mushrooms. I take this book every time I go out in the fall looking for edible mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: This book on mushrooms is a nice one, just a little big for a field ...
customer_reviews.text: This book on mushrooms is a nice one, just a little big for a field guide to carry with you though, but love the colored photos so you really know what you are looking at. Hand drawing are hard to tell color and size, but this with photos is great
customer_reviews.author: mary davidson

customer_reviews.title: Good information, at the cost of scientific naming. Comes with ideal cooking and prepping methods!
customer_reviews.text: Hey guys, as a first time going into mushrooms, I really much enjoyed the colored photos of the mushrooms, the information they give to help identify mushrooms such as the different cap shapes, the veil, gills, and all that nice stuff, and the local naming of them, but within that same reasoning, I believe that they should of added the scientific name for each mushroom beside the local name in parenthesis, maybe not so much for me, but for those that are mycologists. Overall, i'm very satisfied with my purchase of this book, though I am just a beginner in all of this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How can you not love it?
customer_reviews.text: How can you not fall in love with National Audubon Field Guides? I mean, the smell, the feel, the amazing pictures...is there ever anything to dislike? This book is a great size for sticking into your car jockey box for trips, or in your backpack for hikes. The pictures are clear and beautiful, the information about each mushroom is easy to understand and interesting to read. I'd recommend any of the Audubon Field Guides, but this one is especially beautiful for anyone that has a soft spot for mushrooms!
customer_reviews.author: Timbe

customer_reviews.title: Every mycophile and fungi forager needs this
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have a few fungi books but this one is by far my favorite! Such a helpful tool in identifying fungi. The categories make it so much easier to find the fungi you are looking for!
customer_reviews.author: antonia

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to know in one place
customer_reviews.text: This book is fantastic. The illustrations are actual photographs! My husband loves it and my son now wants one too!
customer_reviews.author: Sweetiegold

customer_reviews.title: My companion in the woods
customer_reviews.text: Not as hard to read as other people describe it. Once you know what your looking for, it is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Crespo

customer_reviews.title: Good book, informative
customer_reviews.text: Good book, informative. Some pictures could be better. One poor point - edibility of some mushrooms in the description is sometimes hard to find, vague for some, or missing completely on others. Could be a lot better in that respect.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Faitz

customer_reviews.title: There are a number of great mushroom books
customer_reviews.text: There are a number of great mushroom books, but this one has a system that makes it the easiest to quickly identify your specimen. It's the industry standard around here. Can't beat the price. The plastic cover is great for the field.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best all around mushroom book
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I have purchased this book.. I loan it out and it never comes back.. Best book for all mushrooms
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alot of information
customer_reviews.text: Great guide for identifying. I wouldn't suggest it as a field guide but if identifying at home where you have more time it is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Leala

customer_reviews.title: Very informative
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot in there. It tells what is edible and what is poisonous. A lot of pictures also shows what to look for and a index. I would recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl willliams

customer_reviews.title: Foraging for mushrooms a new hobby for me.
customer_reviews.text: I found the book very informative and something I can take with me while foraging for mushrooms in the Adirondacks.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L McLean

customer_reviews.title: "Guide" is a scholarly but practical research tool
customer_reviews.text: Organized in a scientific, scholarly framework, "Guide" is the practical book you will put in your pack basket as you head out to forage in the fields and forests. it is also small: 4.0" x 7.5" x 1.5" with a tough, leatherette cover. Identification of fungi proceeds through taxonomy in a decision tree where you match or reject a mosaic of characteristics, such as gills or no gills, attachment of gills, type of stem/stipe, found on wood or soil, color, smell, geographic location, proximity to certain trees and flora, and others.
customer_reviews.author: C. Raditz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love all the detail, pictures, descriptions. I am amazed at all the information that is included.
customer_reviews.author: EAC

customer_reviews.title: Another great pick for mushroom foragers
customer_reviews.text: The Audubon Society has been around for many years and the vast resource of knowledge and experience is shown in this book. As everyone knows, eating the wrong mushroom can prove fatal, so it's always better to be informed about even the smaller details of wild mushrooms. While I a relative newcomer to wild mushrooms, I've become an avid participant from the forays, which are usually out in the country side or fairly far up a mountain to discover these delectable treats. This book provides valauble information for anyone interested in this topic.
customer_reviews.author: Andy K

customer_reviews.title: I love my backyard birds, but...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t always know what they are because we are in a migration area. This stays on a shelf on my patio. I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: small but very informative
customer_reviews.text: I love informative reading. This is a nice book to add to a collection of mushroom books.
customer_reviews.author: grandpa

customer_reviews.title: These books rock
customer_reviews.text: Love this book for IDing different shrooms. Has come in handy numerous times. No one has died yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bria

customer_reviews.title: Mushroom hunter must have book
customer_reviews.text: This book is a must-have for a beginner mushroom hunter. Lots of pictures, very informative and fits in your pocket
customer_reviews.author: Jim Francis

customer_reviews.title: Great size and pictures and as described
customer_reviews.text: Great reference book clear pictures. Nice size and cover. What you expect!
customer_reviews.author: Nala

customer_reviews.title: Important, comprehensive info for mushroom hunters
customer_reviews.text: Numerous color photos are keyed to quickly find comprehensive information about each type of mushroom included. A bit too large to carry as a field guide, unless in a backpack. Essential for beginning and intermediate mushroom hunters.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: every mushroom hunter needs one of these
customer_reviews.text: I love the pictures along with all of the information on the mushrooms . I bought 2 copies of this book and we use them year round . Its easy to identify mushrooms and makes it so much fun too
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide worth the cash
customer_reviews.text: Great book it fits in your pocket and has great pictures and info .
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good for identification
customer_reviews.text: All books in their line are the same, good. Is best used to identify mushrooms then you can look them up online for the details you need.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What a cool book. Has great color pictures for easy identification in the field.
customer_reviews.author: linguistchick

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the pics in this book! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mountainman

customer_reviews.title: Best Firld Guide EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I have been hunting edible mushrooms for about 5 years now and am so glad I bought this book. I have owned other good books like "All the rain promises and more" but this book blows all of them out of the water. It has ALL species of north America and a lot more information on the species and are broken up into categories for easier searching. I paid 16.00 with shipping on Amazon.com and found a used copy for 25.00 at a book store. Thanks Amazon. Book on a 1-10? 11!
customer_reviews.author: Micah LTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Terrific reference tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great reference tool for my camera bag. Although details are not adequate for actually eating , it's great to know the mushrooms types and names.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a present. We have many of the National Audubon Society books. He specifically requested the mushroom book. It has a lot of good colorful pictures - well as colorful as they can be when they are of mushrooms. It also provides a great deal of information on the types of mushrooms. I like it because it looks nice on our bookshelf. My husband likes it because it is useful. So all in all everyone is happy - great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alli K

customer_reviews.title: takes a little bit to understand how to use it but once you get it there is none better.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I need to help identify the mushrooms when I am hiking in south Georgia, takes a little bit to understand how to use it but once you get it there is none better.
customer_reviews.author: hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Arrived fairly beat up!
customer_reviews.text: Fieldguide cover bent up so the interior of the cover, the cardboard, is exposed. Will never hold up in the field. Can send picture if needed!?
customer_reviews.author: Keith Badger

customer_reviews.title: Great reference
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and he is really enjoying it. We have 11 acres of wooded property and have observed so many different kinds of mushrooms growing on it that he decided he needed a book to identify them all. I have suggested he create a journal to document his finds.
customer_reviews.author: rileysgranny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pictures. Got these 3 for gifts
customer_reviews.text: Decent price for quick delivery/great book. Ideal book for beginners or seasoned shroom hunters. Excellent pictures.Got these 3 for gifts. Had my own for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A fun guy to read about fungi and taking hiking with ya!
customer_reviews.text: Very excited to take this with me hiking! Book came in fantastic condition and to my surprise came in one day of ordering (which is weird because I don't live in a major city lol). Looking forward to exploring the woods in New England with my book.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mushroom reference book. Easy to follow. One of many books I use to find edible and medicinal mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Rooty

customer_reviews.title: Best books around
customer_reviews.text: Great books, very detailed and very useful. We use them all of the times to determine what we have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cooper (Ignash)

customer_reviews.title: Good book about mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: Great, informative, filled with info ... but it has not made me think that I could successfully identify mushrooms that are ok to eat. I was hoping to be able to confidently pick wild mushrooms for eating.
customer_reviews.author: btrtap

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy, pleased and enjoying learning about mushrooms. Thanks
customer_reviews.text: I received my book in good time and good condition. Love Audubon books.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: A good guide that will get your pretty close to an ...
customer_reviews.text: A good guide that will get your pretty close to an identification but probably not all the way there. There just isn't enough information on each mushroom.
customer_reviews.author: BE from ME

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Had a mushroom in our green house that we could not find. This book helped us narrow it to two possibilities and we will not be eating them :)
customer_reviews.author: MTRanch

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!! PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! My Mither used these guides to teach us on nature hikes through ALL THE NATIONAL PARKS THROUGHOUT the LOWER 48 Contiguous United States!!! NOW, as a CHEF, I can forage locally!! Thanks MOM!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Budney

customer_reviews.title: The definite, but not necessarily the most helpful
customer_reviews.text: This guide is totally helpful, but I would find it more helpful if there was a picture for every entry and if the ordering for pictures and entries were consecutive. The vague mushroom shape identifying guide was totally unhelpful for me. Not a total waste though, but the app that National Audubon produces is much more beneficial to me.
customer_reviews.author: Telly

customer_reviews.title: Audobon Guides are great.
customer_reviews.text: This book is great. The pictures are wonderful. It even tells you which ones are edible. I don't recommend actually eating wild mushrooms unless you are extremely experienced, but nonetheless, this guide is great fun to use and could even save your life if you were stuck in the wilderness and surrounded by mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hillstrom

customer_reviews.title: Noth american mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: Love this book and can't wait to use the book in the mountains again.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comprehensive guide for mushroom hunters and those who want to learn.
customer_reviews.author: noelle k

customer_reviews.title: Great guide, great photographs!!
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid field guide. I never go foraging without this one. Top notch!! Just what you would expect!!
customer_reviews.author: HedLok86

customer_reviews.title: ... identified many mushrooms with the aid of this extremely useful field guide sized book
customer_reviews.text: I have positively identified many mushrooms with the aid of this extremely useful field guide sized book. I live in the mid atlantic region of the USA, and this is my most reliable field book I own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much information makes identifying mushrooms difficult.
customer_reviews.text: This book has so many pages of pictures and information that it is difficult to use the book to quickly identify or find a mushroom that you are seeing outdoors. Also, while the book provides information on many different mushrooms, it does not clearly indicate what mushrooms are, and are not edible. If you want a book that helps you decide what mushrooms are, or not edible, this is not the book for you.
customer_reviews.author: KentR

customer_reviews.title: Good book to learn the mushrooms in the woods
customer_reviews.text: i like this book very much. firstly it is small and compact, easy to carry. secondly, it has a great layout and makes searching easy for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Bai

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Very informational. Helped out a lot. Would highly recommend it to anyone. Has lots of pictures and content.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good factual book. Nice photos. Helpful guide.
customer_reviews.text: Great book. If you are going to gather and eat mushrooms, or just want to know more, this does the trick nicely. My kid really likes it, is learning to identify mushrooms through this guide.
customer_reviews.author: BlueFarmDogPow!

customer_reviews.title: What a deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great field guide .... got it for a great price
customer_reviews.author: PJKerr128

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Love these books, great quality construction and nice photos. Good information.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: Superb book Arrived in perfect condition Packaged very well You'll love it

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Great value and the book was brand new! Got here fast and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: CHYMSL

customer_reviews.title: a must have
customer_reviews.text: this was a replacement of one I lost in a move. Audubon is a must have in any of there books. great pictures and great info.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Sapaugh

customer_reviews.title: Informative.
customer_reviews.text: It's been a wet year and there are lots of toadstools. Nice to know what they are called.
customer_reviews.author: S. Curry

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Fun book. There are so many pretty mushrooms, who knew? Makes my walks in the woods more fun. I can now identify various mushrooms!
customer_reviews.author: BostonMA62

customer_reviews.title: Lovely gift
customer_reviews.text: My brother lost the first copy I bought for him 6 years ago, It was out of stock during this past Christmas, so I am going to greet him with this lovely book today :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great information
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book. Clear photos and text helps determine the species and yheir potability.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Narozanski

customer_reviews.title: and this book helped me begin my mushroom identification process and the beautiful pictures were beautiful as well as extremely
customer_reviews.text: I am new to mycology, and this book helped me begin my mushroom identification process and the beautiful pictures were beautiful as well as extremely helpful with positive identification. It's small enough to fit in a gathering bag or a large pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite book right now! This makes it so easy to identify wild mushrooms. It’s well organized and the pictures are very clear!
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice guide to learning mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice guide to learning mushrooms. It has a very broad spectrum and it is outdated to a point, especially since mushroom Latin names change all the time. Pics are VERY small, but there are great guides on how to iD mushrooms that you find...
customer_reviews.author: Laura L
